needle seam your pumpkin as indicated below pumpkin 1 lose one stitch on either side of the fabric and seam with a mattress stitch worked between the columns of the two edge sts pumpkin 2 & 3 choose which side of the fabric you want to show lose one stitch on either side of the fabric and seam with a mattress stitch finishing with the pumpkin inside out cinch in the end of the pumpkin that had the live stitches by pulling on the yarn tail tight and then sew the yarn tail around the end twice to secure the stitches do not cut the yarn tail yet ensure your pumpkin is the right way out and stuff it firmly with stuffing then using your sharp needle and the yarn tail from the cinched in end pass the needle through the centre of the pumpkin and out of the open top then use this yarn tail swap back to your blunt needle to pick up the loops from the knitted cast on edge try and pick up one loop from the cast on edge for each stitch you can add more stuffing at this point if you need to cinch the stitches in tightly and again secure the stitches in place do not cut the yarn tail continuing with the yarn tail swap back to the sharp needle and sew through the centre of the pumpkin top to bottom then bottom to top each time catching a small amount of fabric very close to the centre point as you do so pull the yarn tail tightly to cinch in the centre of the pumpkin in to achieve the desired shape the tighter you pull the yarn tail flatter and fatter
